plugins.name: Freaking Fake Data
plugins.description:
About plugin:

Freaking Fake Data simplifies your design workflow in Figma, FigJam and Slides by letting you fill mockups with custom, project-specific data instead of random content. Take control of your text layers, create tailored datasets and unify data formats for your design team — perfect for consistent names, phone numbers or other details. Working locally, it boosts productivity and eliminates errors while speeding up mockup creation.


Key Features:

  1. Effortless Mockup Filling: Quickly populate text layers with your data.
  2. Unified Team Data: Import a CSV or JSON file for team consistency.
  3. Bulk Text Magic: Mass-apply text to layers with one click.
  4. Cross-Platform Support: Works in Figma, FigJam and Slides.
  5. Easy Data Import: Upload CSV or JSON files instantly.
  6. Default Data Option: Test with preloaded samples (e.g., names, cities).


How to Use:

  1. Import Data: Create a table in a tool like Google Sheets or Excel, fill it with data, export as CSV or JSON, and upload—or use default data. Import multiple files and switch via tabs.
  2. Select Text Layers: Highlight the text layers to apply data to.
  3. Apply Data: Pick a column (e.g., "First Name") and apply data. Choose order:
  4. Sort: Inserts data in table order.
  5. Random: Inserts data in random order.
  6. Explore Options: Switch tabs, view rows, or use "Set as Default" to save a tab for next launch.


How to Create a Table:

  1. Enter data in columns (e.g., "First Name" in one, "City" in another); the first row becomes button names.
  2. Add separators by leaving a column empty with "---" or "- - -" in the header for a line or use "//Special Offers" or "// Special Offers" for a labeled group divider. (example: telegram)


Perfect for prototypes, presentations or team projects — try it now!
plugins.tagline: Fill Mockups Quickly — use unified data for your design team. Massively paste your text into Figma

plugins.name: Sliding Text
plugins.description:
Sliding Text transforms static text into engaging animated components with just a few clicks. This plugin allows designers to:


  1. Convert any text layer into a dynamic text slide component
  2. Customize animation direction (top-to-bottom, bottom-to-top, left-to-right, right-to-left)
  3. Fine-tune animation timing, stagger delay, and easing
  4. Preview animations directly in the plugin interface
  5. Create components that maintain the original text's font, size, and styling
  6. Generate a "done" state for the final animation frame


Simply select a text layer, enter your phrases or words separated by commas, choose your animation settings, and let the plugin generate a fully configured component with smart animate transitions. Perfect for creating engaging sliding text / rotating messages / dynamic text effects without any coding knowledge.
plugins.tagline: Smooth text slide animations with customizable directions and timing

plugins.name: Select Matching Layers in Frame
plugins.description:
Instantly find repeated frames or component instances within the same frame and edit them all at once.


Figma’s built-in “Select Matching Layers” feature only works across different frames. This plugin is similar but works within a single frame. Quickly select repeating elements within a single frame and adjust their properties, just like the multi-edit feature. For convenience I recommend setting up a custom shortcut for the plugin.


Pair with Master plugin

Turn matching layers into a single component in seconds with the Master plugin:

1. Use Select Matching Layers in Frame to find all repeated elements

2. Run Master → Create Component from Objects

3. Done. You’ll get a single, clean component with overrides preserved


Technical details:

  1. Select all instances of a component (including variants) when selecting an instance
  2. Select all layers with matching name and type when selecting any other layer
  3. Searches within the same frame only
  4. Select multiple objects within different frames, plugin will find all the matches


If you have any questions or feedback, please comment below!
plugins.tagline: Instantly find, select and edit similar layers within a single frame

plugins.name: WCAG Contrast Checker|🔎 تحليل التباين وفقًا لـ WCAG
plugins.description:
في تجربة المستخدم، وضوح النصوص على الخلفيات يلعب دورًا أساسيًا في ضمان قراءة مريحة وسهلة للجميع، بما في ذلك الأشخاص ذوي الإعاقة البصرية. وهنا يأتي دور معايير WCAG التي تحدد نسبة التباين المثلى بين النص والخلفية.


💡 كيف يعمل البلغين؟

📌 حدد النص والخلفية داخل Figma، ثم اضغط على “تحليل التباين”. سيقوم البلغين بحساب نسبة التباين وإظهار تنبيه فوري يخبرك إن كان التباين متوافقًا أو غير متوافق وفقًا لمعايير WCAG.


✅ لماذا هذا مهم؟

✔️ يضمن وضوح النصوص وتحسين تجربة القراءة.

✔️ يساعد المصممين في تحقيق معايير إمكانية الوصول (Accessibility).

✔️ يختصر الوقت في اختبار الألوان داخل التصميم.
plugins.tagline: WCAG Contrast Checker|🔎 تحليل التباين وفقًا لـ WCAG

plugins.name: Banner Framer
plugins.description:
EN description below


バナーサイズの整理をもっと簡単に!!


バナー作成する際、Figmaでのフレームサイズを管理する面倒なストレスを解消します！！Banner Framerを使えば、サイズを忘れたり、フレームの名前を何度も変更する必要がなくなります〜！


Banner Framerの特徴：

•幅と高さを入力するだけでフレームを簡単に生成。

•サイズ情報が含まれた名前を自動で付けて整理をサポート。

•作業効率を上げ、手作業によるミスを軽減。


近日公開：

•サイズプリセットの保存: チームでよく使うバナーサイズを保存して簡単に再利用。

•ワンクリック生成: 保存したサイズをチェックボックスで選択し、瞬時にフレームを生成！

---------------------

Making banner size organization much easier.


Designing banners often requires juggling multiple frame sizes—a task that’s not only repetitive but prone to errors. With Banner Framer, you’ll never forget a size or have to rename frames over and over again.


What Banner Framer does:

•Generate frames effortlessly by entering width and height.

•Automatically name frames with their dimensions for better organization.

•Streamline your workflow and reduce manual errors.


Coming soon:

•Reusable size presets: Save your team’s go-to banner sizes for easy access.

•One-click creation: Select saved sizes with a checkbox and generate frames instantly!
plugins.tagline: Batch-create and customize frames with ease!

plugins.name: Unidup
plugins.description:
Create a design set template that includes component usage and color schemes. With this plugin, you can duplicate your template to a new page, automatically apply new instances of the original component's new variants under consistent layers, and create brand new color schemes.


Additionally, color schemes can be exported in JSON format.



Document Preparation


Document Structure: Prepare the design drafts of the design scheme, which should include "Components Page" and "Template Page", as well as "Color Scheme".


Naming: Each reuse of the design scheme should have a unique name, let's tentatively call it "NAME". This naming is very important as it runs through the entire reuse process.


Template Page: The "Template Page" is the page of your design scheme, and its name should be called NAME. It will play a big role in subsequent work, transforming into various new outputs and serving various new purposes. Therefore, each artboard should contain instances of components for reuse.


Components Page: Each time the design scheme is reused, the output should be unique. The "Components Page" contains unique elements in each set of outputs, and each component should include variants, with the key of the variant being "name" and the value being NAME, to correspond with each set of outputs.


Color Scheme: The naming method for local color schemes in figma is xxx/xxx. When naming, please follow the structure NAME/color1, NAME/color2.



How to Use


Duplicate and Export JSON are two main functions.


Duplicate:

There are three cards in the interface, namely "Components Page", "From Template", and "New Page Naming".


  1. Select your "Components Page", click the "Apply Selected Page" button to the right of "Components Page", and the card will display the details of the "Components Page".
  2. Select your "Template Page", click the "Apply Selected Page" button to the right of "From template", and the card will display the details of the "Template Page".
  3. In the "New Page Naming" card, name your new output.
  4. Click the "Duplicate" button, and you have extended a new output from the "Template Page". Modify the associated components and color scheme, and this output is ready.



Export JSON:

It will list the NAME of all your output schemes, click to export the rgba color values, and download the json to your local.




See usage demo file:

https://www.figma.com/file/jUg3U53QSIzWBEn0RfUdB0/

This plugin helps you batch change icon stroke sizes so that you can maintain consistency and don't have to do it manually. Helps in maintaining a clean design system.

  4. Chose from 3 options as to how you want to scale your stroke sizes.


This is a work in progress. Any comments and feedback would be appreciated.

plugins.name: Layer Name Lister
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin that provides a hierarchical view of selected layers and their children. This plugin makes it easy to copy layer names with their complete hierarchy or simple structure for documentation, handoff, or reference purposes.


Also pretty useful if the layers need to be fed to an LLM for cross checking against a checklist of fields that need to be included in the UI (that's why I developed this plugin)


Features

- Recursive Layer Traversal: Lists all selected layers and recursively shows their children

- Multiple Output Formats:

- Full Paths: Shows complete hierarchical paths of each layer

- Simple Names: Shows only the layer names without parent paths

- JSON Format: Structured data format including layer IDs, types, and hierarchy

- Cycle Detection: Avoids infinite loops with automatic cycle detection

- Copy to Clipboard: One-click copy of the entire layer hierarchy

- Live Updates: Automatically updates when selection changes

- Resizable Interface: Adjust the plugin window size to your needs

- Performance Optimized: Handles large layer structures efficiently with batch processing


Outputs

Full Paths (Default)

Frame 1
Frame 1 / Button
Frame 1 / Button / Label
Frame 1 / Button / Icon
Frame 1 / Content
Frame 1 / Content / Title
Frame 1 / Content / Description


Simple Names

Frame 1
Button
Label
Icon
Content
Title
Description


JSON Format

[
{
"id": "1:2",
"name": "Frame 1",
"type": "FRAME",
"path": "Frame 1",
"level": 0,
"children": [
{
"id": "1:3",
"name": "Button",
"type": "INSTANCE",
"path": "Frame 1 / Button",
"level": 1,
"children": [...]
},
...
]
}
]
plugins.tagline: A plugin that will give you a plain text list of the layers you have selected (incl. children)

plugins.description:
Transform Your Design Process with AI-powered Insights


Ai Design Review is a cutting-edge Figma plugin designed to help designers optimize their work by providing AI-driven design reviews. With this plugin, you can instantly analyze your designs and receive suggestions for improvement based on best practices in typography, layout, color schemes, accessibility, and overall visual consistency.


By utilizing AI technology, Ai Design Review helps you ensure that your designs adhere to industry standards, making your workflow more efficient and your designs more polished. The plugin automatically scans your design file, analyzes it against key design principles, and highlights potential issues, offering actionable insights and suggestions to improve the design's quality and user experience.


Whether you're a solo designer or part of a design team, Ai Design Review will serve as your AI assistant, providing real-time feedback to enhance your design’s impact and usability.


Key Features:

Automated Design Analysis: Instantly scan your designs for inconsistencies, color imbalances, accessibility issues, and more.


AI-Driven Recommendations: Receive intelligent suggestions for design improvements tailored to your project.


Customizable Feedback: Choose the types of design elements you want to receive feedback on, such as typography, spacing, or color.


Efficient Workflow: Save time and enhance collaboration by automatically detecting and fixing common design mistakes.


Boost your design efficiency and improve your work with Ai Design Review — your AI-powered design assistant.

plugins.name: Conjure - AI based text generator
plugins.description:
Introduction


Use your OpenAI API key with this plugin to quickly generate text for your designs. The plugin can allows to generate multiple text layers based on the content. Furthermore, it can also group the layers by their names, allowing you to use the layer names in the prompt to further elaborate how you want the data to be filled in.


How to use


The plugin was primarily created for 2 use cases:


1. Generate variations of a single type of data:

  1. Select all the text layers that show the same type of data and you want to generate variations of it. Imagine Name, City, Stock price, etc.
  2. Make sure 'Group by layer name' is OFF.
  3. Add details to the prompt to explain the type of content you want to be generated for the selected fields. Giving examples and formatting is also helpful.
  4. Click generate and it will fill the information!



2. Generate variations of multiple types of data:

  1. Select all the frames or components that you want to fill using this plugin.
  2. Turn ON 'Group by layer name'. The plugin will show you the layer names found.
  3. Add details to the prompt to explain the type of content you want to be generated for the selected fields. You can use the layer names to add specific context. Giving examples and formatting is also helpful.
  4. Click generate and it will fill the information!


3. Generated related data

You can use the group by layer name to select singular text layers which are related. An example is when you need text for First name, Last name, DoB, role, location and relatives. The plugin will try to generate related content for these layers.


Note


1. This plugin needs an OpenAI API Key to work.

2. I will recommend naming your text layers appropriately if you plan to use the Group by layer name feature. You can use it without naming the layers, but sometimes this might result in unexpected results.
plugins.tagline: OpenAI powered text generator with batch text generation feature

  2. Extract text with AI-friendly reference tags
  3. Use any LLM while maintaining the safety tags
  4. Review changes with automatic validation
  5. Apply updates with confidence

plugins.name: 角落艺术家
plugins.description:
In the new version of "Corner Artist," I've added a language switch feature between Chinese and English. Here, you can freely switch to your preferred language as needed.


The new version optimizes the user experience, making the overall UI more refined and convenient.


By clicking the button, you can randomly switch to your favorite gradient colors.

Additionally, the new version introduces a "Random Corner Radius" feature, allowing you to choose the layer you want to modify and adjust the corner radius strength.


Here, the higher the value, the smaller the corner radius strength.


I’ve used the superellipse corner radius formula:

|x/a|^n + |y/b|^n = 1

When n = 2, it’s a regular ellipse;

When n < 2, it’s a superellipse;

The smaller the value of n, the closer the corners are to right angles.


For those interested, you can explore the formula on your own; I’ll post it in the comments.

When you choose a corner radius strength less than 1, you'll also receive stars as a bonus.


That's about it for the new features. Feel free to experience and save them!
plugins.tagline: Making the overall UI more refined and convenient.

113419.name: 角落艺术家
113419.description:
In the new version of "Corner Artist," I've added a language switch feature between Chinese and English. Here, you can freely switch to your preferred language as needed.


The new version optimizes the user experience, making the overall UI more refined and convenient.


By clicking the button, you can randomly switch to your favorite gradient colors.

Additionally, the new version introduces a "Random Corner Radius" feature, allowing you to choose the layer you want to modify and adjust the corner radius strength.


Here, the higher the value, the smaller the corner radius strength.


I’ve used the superellipse corner radius formula:

|x/a|^n + |y/b|^n = 1

When n = 2, it’s a regular ellipse;

When n < 2, it’s a superellipse;

The smaller the value of n, the closer the corners are to right angles.


For those interested, you can explore the formula on your own; I’ll post it in the comments.

When you choose a corner radius strength less than 1, you'll also receive stars as a bonus.


That's about it for the new features. Feel free to experience and save them!
113419.tagline: Making the overall UI more refined and convenient.

plugins.name: Figma Instance Mode
plugins.description:
Inspired by this post: Please add an "Instance Selection" mode - Share an idea - Figma Community Forum


🔶 Introducing Figma Instance Mode


- ⤴️ Select Instance

- ✅ Instance Mode On

- 🚫 Instance Mode Off


⤴️ Select Instance


check if there is a parent or ancestor instance with your selection, and then will redirect your selection to the instance


It is the same as the official feature named `select instance`, but with this plugin you can blind a hotkey to this feature.


✅ Instance Mode On


Once you run this command, every time when you change your selection in Figma will run the `⤴️ Select Instance` command automatically which means you will always select the instance if your selection is within a instance.


And there will be a inspect window to show the program running result, you can get information with it.


🚫 Instance Mode Off


This feature is to turn off the instance mode, and close the inspect window


🔶 How to add GLOBAL SHORTCUT in MacOS


Check the tutorial: Custom-shortcuts-in-figma by Jussi Virtanen


MacOS Global Shortcut Path:


Plugins->Saved plugins->Figma Instance Mode->⤴️ Select Instance


Plugins->Saved plugins->Figma Instance Mode->✅ Instance Mode On


Plugins->Saved plugins->Figma Instance Mode->🚫 Instance Mode Off

accepted.name: RyanHuang 👀
accepted.description:
🔸 Product Designer
🔸 Heavy user of Figma
🔸 Beginner in FE

plugins.tagline: Selecting parent/ancestor instances automatically

plugins.name: Mendly — Merge & Fix Broken Variables
plugins.description:
**Streamline your design system maintenance with powerful variable management tools.**


## Key Features


**🔄 Smart Variable Merging**

- Combine duplicate color variables into one

- Automatically updates all references throughout your design

- Preserves semantic variable relationships

- Optional renaming during merge process


**🔧 Broken Variable Detection & Repair**

- Scans current page for broken variable references

- Smart suggestions based on variable naming patterns

- Navigate between elements using the same broken variable

- Batch fix multiple variables at once


**⚡ Intelligent Analysis**

- Shows direct vs semantic variable usage

- Counts affected elements before merging

- Identifies variable dependencies

- Context-aware replacement suggestions


**🎯 Perfect For**

- Design system cleanup and maintenance

- Removing duplicate variables after design updates

- Fixing broken references after variable deletions

- Streamlining color variable organization


**💡 How It Works**

1. Select source variable (will be removed) and target variable (will remain)

2. Preview affected elements and usage statistics

3. Merge variables with one click - all references automatically update

4. Use the fix tool to repair any broken variable links


Save hours of manual work and keep your design system clean and organized!
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly merge duplicate variables and fix broken references in your design system.

plugins.name: TapTail
plugins.description:
😌 No explicit sign-ups, logins or permissions are required to use TapTail. Just run the plugin!


Have you ever wanted to know if the Figma proto you shared was opened? To see where people clicked? To get insights how your proto works? Read on 👇


Use this example prototype created by Figma to try: https://www.figma.com/community/file/915647337333327091/figma-for-beginners-2020-petma-the-social-media-app-for-pets


TapTail brings real usability data into Figma with minimal effort. Install the plugin, create a prototype sharing link, share the link with your subjects and start collecting metrics. Once you collected enough data (at least one session), you will be able to generate a report directly in your prototype's Figma document (on a separate page).


💬 Feedback and questions (I read and reply to every e-mail): laci@taptail.com

♥️ Found it useful? A 'Like' would mean the world to me! :)


————————


Tired of bouncing between Figma and external usability test tools? With TapTail, you can see metrics directly in Figma:

  1. Session details: Total time spent, time to first click , count of unique sessions and more.
  2. Click positions: Numbered circles on each frame show exactly where and in what order users tapped.
  3. Interaction density: How many taps landed on each screen, helping you spot hot and cold zones.
  4. Labels: Add a tag when copying links to know which channel drove each test.


Your original designs stay untouched: all results are exported on a separate page and overlaid on separate layers of your designs' clones.


————————


🛟 How to use

A very detailed, step-by-step guide on how to create a sharing link and a report:


Creating a sharing link:

  1. Run the plugin.
  2. Click the blue 'Create' button.
  3. Provide a 'Name' and your Figma prototype's sharing URL (simply copy like you normally would and paste it here) then click the blue 'Create' button at the bottom. Once done, it will show you a list with the created item on top.
  4. Click the item's link icon to copy the TapTail sharing link: it will ask if you'd like to track the link (this is optional but recommended: use only numbers and lowercase, english alphabet letters without spaces).
  5. Click the blue 'Copy link [...]' button. Sharing link is now copied on your clipboard.
  6. Share the link with your test subjects. When they open it in their browser, your prototype will appear like the original Figma prototype (as if you would shared from the figma.com link).


Report generation:

  1. Run the plugin in the same Figma document where the shared prototype is located (this is important ❗️).
  2. You can check for new sessions with the 'Refresh' link on the top right corner.
  3. Once you have at least 1 session, you can create a report by pressing the 'Play' button.
  4. A confirmation pop-up will appear first. If you confirm, report generation will start and a loading indicator will appear (normally a report generation takes a few seconds, but could be more depending on your machine's computational capacity and the volume of the collected data).
  5. Report is generated on a new page in the document.


————————


⏳ License & Trial

TapTail is currently in open beta, therefore all features and functions are free for a limited period of time! Feedbacks, questions, bug reports: please and thank you 🤗


————————


🔐 Data handling & privacy

TapTail does NOT need access to your name, e-mail, files, comments, projects, components or styles to work. It only needs a very limited set of data to function:


Your identity

  1. Your Figma user ID is stored, but only in a scrambled form called a hash. A hash is like a one-way fingerprint: can't turn it back into the real ID. Your ID is needed to assign your account the free license.
  2. Other identity related data is only needed if you buy a license, then at least a billing name, billing address and an e-mail address is required.


Your prototype link

Your Figma prototype sharing URL (copied from Figma, provided by you manually) must be stored so your prototype can be served for your users via the TapTail sharing link (which looks like this: https://ux.taptail.com/s/<handle>). Part of the prototype link is a string called the 'file key' (format: https://www.figma.com/proto/<file key>/…) which identifies your Figma document. Since the prototype sharing URL is stored, the file key is also stored (as part of the URL). Read more about the implications here and here.


Prototype emitted events

List of Figma emitted events that are captured (with timestamp + data such as node ID, click and scroll cooridnates, etc. – for more info, click the event name below):

  1. MOUSE_PRESS_OR_RELEASE
  2. PRESENTED_NODE_CHANGED
  3. INITIAL_LOAD
  4. NEW_STATE
  5. REQUEST_CLOSE
  6. LOGIN_SCREEN_SHOWN
  7. PASSWORD_SCREEN_SHOWN


This data is only used to build your in-Figma reports and are never shared with anyone else.

You can learn more about embeds in general here: Embed Figma Files.


————————


🚧 Roadmap & new features

In no particular order, directly from my todo list:

  1. define expiration date+time;
  2. define simple instructions/ welcome screen;
  3. designated success screen (to enable missions);
  4. component variant change handling;
  5. data export in structured form (like JSON, CSV, …);
  6. <your ideas maybe? get in touch!>


————————


🪳 Found a bug? Got feedback? Have an idea for a feature?

E-mail me at laci@taptail.com!

I read and reply to every e-mail :)


————————


🫶 Credits

  1. The prototype used for demo in the video: https://www.figma.com/community/file/915647337333327091/figma-for-beginners-2020-petma-the-social-media-app-for-pets
